source.author: Duretto, M.F.
source.title: Apiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae

leads.lead_text: Mature mericarps with seed wall clearly visible between the thin ribs
Mature mericarps with thick corky ribs that almost obscure the seed wall
Plants erect, to 20 cm high; annuals; umbels sessile
Plants erect or prostrate with stems usually longer than 30 cm; biennials; umbels usually pedunculate
Plants erect, stout, stems 0.4–1 cm diam.; umbels thickly pedunculate; peduncle to 8.5 cm long
Plants usually weak and scrambling, stems less than 0.5 cm diam.; umbels usually sessile, or if not, then thinly pedunculate and peduncle to 2 cm long
